subject: Re: Large, hierarchical, randomized test suites: how to not run out of memory?
msgSnippet: OK... This is really ridiculous, but it turns out there is a super-simple way to efficiently get the functionality I need using JUnit 3.8. It s called
messageBody:
OK... This is really ridiculous, but it turns out there is a super-simple way to efficiently get the functionality I need using JUnit 3.8. It's called junit.extensions.RepeatedTest. All I need to do is replace

public static TestSuite suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite ("name of the test suite");
for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++)
suite.addTest(new Test1());
return suite;
}

with

public static TestSuite suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite ("name of the test suite");
suite.addTest(new RepeatedTest (newTest1(), 1000));
return suite;
}

and I'm done.

Thanks for your help anyway!
